Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GUZkVsOr2RiMYdL-9IG1Ag.text: Ordered the carnitas and they were fantastic.  Went back the next day and ordered the chili verde, outstanding.

SvMo_uC_1Pu4uov-aUOYEw.text: The food is good... but the custom cocktails make Javiers. I am not a tequila person but the margaritas here are so delightful.  I love that premade mixers are not the norm.  The bartenders are skilled and know what they are doing.  This is a fantastic place to come for dinner but even more so for just drinks with friends.

KbSYtaDsD7Kremeise18pg.text: I liked this place enough to come back again and order the Carnitas plate.  The chips were warm and thin and the salsa very tasty with the right amount of hot.  Sitting at the bar, you can easily view the decor ropes traveling up to the ceiling depicting a black hole gravity model.  Viewing the faraway sports screen would require binoculars- but that's ok.  It's a low light atmosphere with music that works well with a date or colleagues.  The reason for docking stars is the carnitas plate.  I was expecting a moist clump of pork.  What I got was mountain-pass wind-blown pork with a shell like a crab.  Drill into it and you will find trace amounts of moisture at its core.  I suppose I could soak the pork in my glass of water to simulate freshness.  It would look cool being magnified with the fork and all.  Someone should try this and post a picture.

63P4LNj4SBb2Ludg6aNHzQ.text: Love this place! Despite the disappointment of the two ARIA restaurant recently, Javier has been consistent in their service, food. Their complementary salsa and chips is delicious! (Can't get over their salsa...!) my favorite items to get is their Ceviche trio, shrimp tacos! Their pineapple margaritas is also refreshing and delicious! Their hosts however can use some training in friendly customer service when you call to make reservations, and time to time some of the hosts can act very snobby!

ASqrfbL50CLSVQAoJvWp8w.text: A great experience both times we dined here. It's hard to get a table even if you try to reserve, but myself and husband sat at the bar where we enjoyed dinner and cocktails. Very busy up-beat vibe and nice servers. We ordered the chicken fajitas and they were delicious! Ordered them again the second time! Removed a star due to not being able to get a table even when we called to book early on. But that's a good problem to have right? Will definitely be returning next time I'm in Vegas. Thank you for two wonderful evenings.

gP__4E3Mywu4fnxbM-HKMw.text: I live in San Diego which is top mexican food central & wish we had a Javier's here! I went here for the first time last weekend while away for a weekend in Vegas. This place was amazing!! I LOVE me some good margaritas but boy good ones are hard to come by. Usually two sweet for my liking. These were perfect!! I loved the cucumber and the jalapeno margarita! Chips and salsa were out of this world. My hubby & I shared the combo sampler plate (I forgot what it was called) and I wish I was still hungry because I wanted to eat more food but I was so full!! Hands down best Mexican restaurant I have ever been to. This prices were a little on the higher side but reasonable in my opinion for the quality you are getting. Our service was absolutely amazing too. I hope the one in Irvine is as good because I need this in my life and don't want to have to go to Vegas to get it!

BOiDF8hrj36gY8s4T9DSug.text: I love this place. It is overpriced, for sure. But when the chips and salsa, enchiladas Suiza, beer, and tequila selection are all good then it's fine. You don't come here to be cheap.

TVYg3maAIUj2pLS3PP8cLg.text: Love this place. The drinks are always perfect, service is great, the ambiance is stunning and the food is terrific. On our most recent visit, I enjoyed the carne asada quesadilla and my husband had the carnitas with corn tortillas. We were both totally knocked out. So good! Our friends enjoyed the queso as well. We will be back every time we are in Vegas, that's for sure.

kZhHRG2a1OW7VRJbGjQEsQ.text: The place, the location, the food, the servers, the drinks. All top of the line. I had the best experience here. The food is amazing and presented beautifully! The car is surrounded by a grand chandelier. It's such a classy place. If your in Vegas, do yourself a favor and eat dinner here before having a night on the town. It will set the tone for the rest of the night! Also the bathrooms are even top notch... complete with a woman putting lotion on your hand and giving you a mini hand massage. They definitely take can of you.  5 stars by far. If I could give 6 I would.

k723nGKygFZVxHwiURPo3g.text: It is all about the scene....nothing about the food. The famous lobster enchilada was so overscooked it was inedible. The margarita was ordinary. The ceviche was OK but nothing special. The beans and rice were oversalted. This just doesn't work if you know food.....it is a pretty place though if that is all you want.

6ZbW54rXu9pvzGtYTygnhA.text: Hands down my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas! Best Mexican food. Ask for the server Angel. He is the best server we have ever had in our lives. This place is amazing!

FCJVP4ouY9jePNf40YpjhQ.text: Absolutely loved the food and the service! Every time I come to Vegas I like trying out different restaurants, but Javiers is definitely one I'll be visiting again  the lobster enchiladas and the carne asada were my favorite.

ou3cZw8j0EQsf2DrgoeXUw.text: Best Chicken Mole in 2 states (southern California and Nevada). Food, Ambiance & Service is Great. A great Selection of Spirits too, Tequila and Single Malt Scotch, highly recommend to make reservations to either locations, always a hot place to people watch.

qvStO_yikXi2BtbKT0eXBQ.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant ever!!!!! I love their Nachos De La Casa. There workers are so nice.

5oKToyVa64wtI_VK3Xc1jA.text: Overpriced food, that wasn't very good. The service was so-so. The really only redeeming quality about this place was the decor. Felt kind of like Pirates of the Caribbean meets Vegas.

LyB7dHWccJFVMHafOhaF3w.text: Went with my wife and friends. We have been to the Javier's in Newport Beach and it was very good so we expected at least the same. We live in Vegas and dine out a lot. Javier's is really decorated very nice. Waiter brought us menus. It was so dark in the restaurant that we had a hard time reading the menus. The waiter came by and gave us a flashlight. We ordered guacamole . I've had better guacamole out of a plastic container from a grocery store. You'd think a high end Mexican restaurant would know how to make guacamole. I ordered Carnitas. It was very good. My wife and friends ordered tacos and enchiladas . They all commented there food was average. Service was so-so. Not great but not bad. I thought the prices were very high for what we ordered. Will not eat there again.

aQ8te-QjKhKkIhDJmbaACg.text: Simply disgusting. I got the appetizer taquitos and had shredded beef as the filling. It smelled and tasted horrible that i immediately got nauseas. My husband and brother got nachos because they played it safe, and STILL it was disgusting. They had the chicken and shredded beef and they both sat there with an empty stomach than to fill themselves with what smelled like cow manure.

V_XvsR_x8TChXNHCNnsjdw.text: A++  This restaurant is amazing both in atmosphere and menu. The service was excellent. I highly recommend the Cano Azul and La Tablita plates. One of the best Mexican restaurants I have eaten at.  A MUST try!

photos.caption: Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cabo Azul Plate. Excellent!
Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lK7A9d5gSJXe5e_Z0IEVHQ.text: Went to dinner with some friends and was unsure about this place.  it was kinda dark and the wall by our table was hand carved skulls and skeletons all over it.  The steak i ordered was cooked perfect.  It came with a side of guacamole and black beans, and had a pepper sticking out that looked like Asparagus so i ate it in one shot not realize it was the hottest pepper i've ever eaten in my life!!!!

gn4dBgY5pM7vV4Nx1LgyxA.text: An average Mexican food place. I ordered the taco with enchilada combo. It was ok. The chips and salsa was ok too. I would say it's like any average Mexican restaurant. Not bad but not impressive.

k9Pevy9zVmOgz1YFBHrbUQ.text: The atmosphere is absolutely beautiful.  I ordered the Cabo Azul.  My food was barely warm when it got to me including the rice and beans.  The guacamole was horrid.  We sent it back.  Way too simple, no onions, no tomatoes, no cilantro, no spices.  Just avocado and cheese sprinkled on top.  The shrimp taco was decent.  The house salsa wasn't bad.  The best thing about the meal was the pineapple margarita which had WAY too much ice so you only got 4 or 5 slurps through the straw and I'm not a regular drinker.  Ha!  We mentioned there was a birthday at the table and not even a scoop of complimentary ice cream.  I would go back for drinks possibly if I was in the Aria but I wouldn't make it a point to go there.  The cafe inside of Cardenas supermarket is way better.  Extremely overpriced for Mexican food, but the atmosphere is gorgeous..

v_S7Tedc_y8G_5OiF4_9CQ.text: Read my tips about this establishment... FOOD SERVED COLD! Young guy manager, owners son or nephew comes over and DOES NOT LISTEN to anything my girlfriend has to say about FOOD SERVED COLD!!!!! STAY AWAY!!!!  0 Stars!!!!!  For Mexican go to DIABLO's!!!

r7V8jQb6qG9TYVLtlaUCTw.text: Best Mexican restaurant I've ever been to. The food is amazing. The enchiladas were everything.. Definitely need to check this place out.

2p_dn4H4J6fO9iAX3c4JTQ.text: Whoa, wow! Stay away. Server never refilled water, asked about food or came to give bill. We had to walk to front counter and ask for bill. Only then did server come running to ask anything. The busser did ask about water refill during appetizer and he did do it. Busser was great. Thank you very much. You did so much better. Server absolutely terrible. Empty waters during the whole meal. We will never be back. They can check cameras to verify and they will see.  Spoke to manager and he needed to speak to server first and I completely understand that. Clearly makes sense. Unfortunately,  no result or phone call back. This is a casino so the cameras will prove it...... A complete waste of money. Did I mention 6 to 8 employees passed by, setting tables, removing dishes, etc and nothing.. Billy, your service skills are absolutely terrible. (on receipt the name is as cashier, hopefully it is and if not I am sorry. If not, your computer system needs updates). Will not visit again. :(  Update - Called from room to manager that night and told he would call back. Wait for it.....next day and still no contact by management.

t1x5YvZ2IwO67lv2NNCZXg.text: Started off with our waiter missing the salad that was ordered.  Then my shrimp and crab enchiladas at $30 were somewhat bland. I wouldn't think it was canned but the shrimp sure tasted like it.  Portions were on the small side since my 110 pound wife finished her meal which I can't recall what it was but she said it was tasty.  Nice ambiance in the Aria casino, we ate on a Wednesday night before the July 4th weekend.  Since great Mexican food is available in the SW/West you really need to take it up a notch in Las Vegas because there are numerous better places to eat there.

OrC1OrAXpdR0uSPDqlu-ow.text: Went in mid day, beautiful decor, great service, just got a small bite to share, shrimp and crab enchiladas, the green sauce is amazing, but the food was luke warm at best. I expected a bit more quality, Unless enchiladas are supposed to be cold then Id give it 5 stars.

pZMgVkJN4-9U4fYF5KM3Sw.text: it is pricey.  it is Aria.  it's all good. if you are looking for dollar tacos or frozen margaritas, go downtown.  just saying...

Sp7yKjLTVnmBPJghxJXfmA.text: Never had a bad meal here. Have to stop at Javiers atleast once anytime when visiting Vegas. Excellent margaritas, excellent food, and great service. Highly recommend the seafood enchiladas or carnitas!

Vows29OmAWJraOKmBnm_aA.text: Bar and appetizers as we were in a hurry pre-show (off to Thunder Down Under for a shocker time with an "older" birthday girl.)  Margaritas and men were fresh and strong that night.  Traditional Javier's margarita on the rocks-hit the spot--$18 worth of thirst quencher, party starter!  Chambord margarita was too sweet for my friend, but I willingly traded for my second traditional.   Why the 3 star rating, you ask.  Well, the food was not good.  5 soft tacos on a plate for $24--tried 2 beef, 2 chicken, 1 pork.  Dry, flavorless, even with adding cabbage and small amount of guac, which was provided on the side.  Go for drinks.  Bar had nice, energetic atmosphere.  Others seemed to like dinner, so maybe that's better than our one sampling.

UJgvr8H5ZP6QWtCgRYJ1KA.text: The Mexican rice was bland. I had the spinach enchiladas which had a little spice to them which I liked. I did not like how they used corn as filler. Their martini menu was boring, especially for the price. $18 for a martini is expected in Vegas but please... something better than a basic Cosmo.

x8cNgMmXte5YReiCU0ABCw.text: I cannot understand why this place is in the orange with stars when clearly, they should be in the red! I gave five stars for a few reasons. One, the place is beautiful, the hostesses were very nice and the bartender made my drinks just right. Two, when we finally got a table I walked thru checking out the decor which was fab!!! And Three, my meal was freaking fantastic and so was everyone else's meal who dined with me! I saw nothing but clean plates at the end of the meal. I ordered the Fineo Del Mar which was a linguine with seafood in a creamy pinkish sauce which was perfectly spicy! The shrimp and scallop were beautifully grilled and the green onion added perfect flavor. The waiter told me it would be DELISH and he was dead on! Our waiter was really great and really sweet and he kept telling me how good I smelled ;-). So needless to say, I spent a week in Vegas for work and really didn't get to eat out until my last night in town and I am so happy we chose Javier's! What a treat after a rough work week. Hey! You gotta check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño Margarita $16.95
Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fineo Del Mar...$30

gTMqfUxMEb5rE0e59ylqng.text: Arrived at 7:45 pm on a Monday night and we were told that the wait for a table would be 45 to 60 minutes. No problem - we ordered margaritas and enjoyed the chips and salsa. At 8:45, we inquired about our table and we were told that it would be another 15 minutes. At 9:00, we inquired again about our table and we were told it would be a "minute or two." At 9:15, we inquired again and we were told we were "next up" on the list.   At this point we gave up and went to a local favorite called Firefly. We were seated immediately, the service was awesome and the food was just as great!   So skip the poorly managed Javier's and head to Firefly!

F_2cht257bcWdbtTKbou-Q.text: Hands down these guys & gals enjoy giving you  impeccable service with a smile & take pride in their work. The bar is spotless. Always cleaning. Ok so food..amazing. Definitely get the chicken taquitos!! They are the best! I also got crispy tacos which are huge and the shells don't break into 50 pieces. The beef isn't nasty ground beef either it's shredded beef! We ate there 2 nights ago & went back the next day.  And if you want a great Margherita without all the sugar & calories get 1 of their Organica. Doesn't disappoint.

Qr3acgbU9y_FTKaQ7umj8A.text: Located in the hustle and bustle of the Aria, Javier's is a transplant of the OG restaurant in Newport Beach, CA.  It was packed on a Friday nite, but a great place to enjoy some authentic and Mexican fusion dishes on the strip.   The cocktails were solid, and the food tasty, but like most Strip located joints, prices were a bit pricey.   Overall, the atmosphere and ambiance makes paying for a $18 margarita worth the squeeze.   Portions are a bit on the smaller size, so if you have a big appetite, you've got 3 choices.   1- eat a late lunch.  2- pick up some Cosmo Hidden Pizza next door afterwards.  3- double up on the dishes.  In the end, you can't lose!

photos.caption: Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qjFYB1ZlGWlttcHIhK3WqQ.text: Worthy for a 4.5 if possible. Beautiful decor and elegant ambience. The service at the bar was impeccable with a very polite and courteous bar team. The bar area was very clean. The chicken taquitos were delicious. Also, I would highly recommend the "Organic" Margarita. If you like Mexican food with class, this is the place for you.

qg7ZQbx2DxfjkSqTRLG_Bg.text: Javier's is a beautiful restaurant/lounge in the middle of the Aria casino. This spot was packed on a Friday night - so it is absolutely critical that you have a reservation.   The food and drinks were incredible - every enchilada and fajita at our table was delicious and flavorful. But the margaritas were the highlight - from spicy, to fruity, to on the rocks, to frozen, all of them were made to perfection.   The one downfall was that our waitress was extremely overwhelmed and did not provide the best service - we understood it was packed, but we ordered apps and tequila shots that often never arrived. We had to continually remind her after long lengths of time, and she seemed quite forgetful. That was slightly frustrating at an upscale restaurant.   Overall, I recommend, but consider going at an off time!

photos.caption: Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ujElRhR7Fmnr3GGHZkFZBw.text: Javier's is a fantastic Mexican restaurant located at the beautiful Aria casino in Las Vegas. By Vegas standards, it's priced fairly reasonably. Service and atmosphere are top notch. And most importantly, the food is incredible. This place is well worth your time.

OjVi0SLydY48ZAkUBsOL1w.text: Ordered the seafood trio enchiladas. Excellent as usual. Cocktail was spot on delicious as well. Service was very attentive

photos.caption: Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar Area

cAi7ogMfrqHCzTjU1K59tg.text: Our dinner was delicious. I loved the Chile verde. The manager was very accommodating to moving us to a booth. My friend loved her taco & enchilada. We had a great time.

photos.caption: Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

US_iUMNhBKS2hAhx1nUlog.text: Wow what a cool place. We came here for dinner one night while we were in Vegas and I just loved the ambiance. We sat at the bar top as we usually do at most places. Our bar tender immediately came over with menus and chips and salsa. We put some drink orders in while we perused the menu.  The chips and salsa were so yummy which got me excited to order food. I ordered the carnitas and my better half ordered the carne asada. The food was soooooooo good I literally could not stop eating. The meat fell off the bones and was so delicious!!! The carne asada was perfectly cooked and also so incredibly yummy.  The only thing that stops me from giving this place 5 full stars is simply because this place is slightly over priced for cocktails even for Vegas. Come here for the food before the drinks. Would definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada

gcyKwQdb5SjQ3OJC3mSRXQ.text: First night in Vegas for the New Years celebration and we decided on Javiers for dinner. The place was crowded but the service was very good and quick. The atmosphere is an upscale Mexican vibe and the food was great. I had the Cabo Azul and loved it. Very tasty and well prepared. My only complaint, and I find this in many of Vegas restaurants, is that the music is just way to loud so it makes having a conversation almost impossible.

HAOEjT7ePoliRqGonnJidg.text: Love this place Oscar was our waiter he is the best . His service was amazing.The atmosphere here is wonderful. I give him a 5 star and the place itself a 5 star .

LTpdrY0EZBobRa7IgsQR9w.text: Favorite Mexican on the strip by far. Great lobster enchiladas. Love the atmosphere and drinks.

KRm3HlpYrKV5NBM_atNB6Q.text: This is a go-to restaurant every time I am in Las Vegas. Their service is up to par even on their busiest of nights. Most importantly, their food is flawless, delicious and well-presented. Even as simple as mexican corn esquites is outrageously delicious. Hands down, this is one of my all-time favourite restaurants. 5*s!!

yDknKiiMIkMldH6lZb4SRA.text: Best Mexican food on the strip.  Reasonable prices and their cocktail drinks are very good.  I recommend the cucumber margarita or if you want a little kick the jalapeno margarita is good.  Hope or make sure you get Veronica great customer service and constantly checking up on you making sure everything is good and/or correct with your order.  La mejor comida Mexican en el strip.  Los preciosos razonables y las margaritas ni se diga les recomiendo la margarita de pepino o la de jalapeno.  Si quieren tener un buen servicio y una mesera atenta les recomiendo que pregunten por Veronica.

wn2lRdVtYRbF4qPyV1zZbA.text: The service here is appalling. Savada P. and Moisas delivered the worst service we have ever experienced. Savada P. made a mistake of adding onions-which I am allergic to and notified her- to my food. Instead of apologizing Moisas threatened to call security. We love Javier's and are extremely disappointed with this dining experience.

0ZyVCd36rY_VOktqrP0ybw.text: Javier's is centrally located right of the casino floor in Aria. The restaurant's decor is modern Mexican with great use of textures, lighting and artwork. The ambiance is high energy as the casino floor is so close yet the mood is comfortable with low lighting.  The bar greets you with a great selection of tequilas. My biggest complaint was the weak pours in the Margaritas. A couple people in our group complained they were not feeling the buzz after two rounds of margaritas and I agreed. Why be stingy on $18 cocktails?!  The mood and ambiance make this the top high end Mexican eatery on the strip. The food doesn't disappoint. We had table side guacamole, fajitas, enchiladas, tacos and chopped salad. Everything was fresh and delicious.   The service was friendly but a bit slow. We were trying to make a show and asked for expedited service. They struggled to accommodate and butchered two guests orders. Oops! I personally received a chicken taco when I ordered beef. No biggie it was still good.  Will happily come back as I have already returned several times. Javier's don't be scared to share your tequila, $20 margarita drinkers tend to know their stuff and expect a kick!!

photos.caption: Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Javier's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carved wood sculpture.

DpytEzVDfefchO59zYYjMQ.text: Used to LOVE this place.... now I just really like it. Last time I was there (oct 18ish) the chef decided to steer the menu towards the fancier side instead of just good food. I hope the chef decides to revert back on my next visit!  Open table for reservations would also be a nice change!

sMaCu7uFjPj5a_1cLvWHLw.text: Javier's earned every single star during our visit for dinner on a Sunday night! From the waiter's (Jose) recommendations about food and drink choices to the setting of the restaurant, it was all exceptional. They have so many delicious menu options that it was hard for us to choose just one! I had the braised short ribs with a negro sauce that was served with white rice. This was a dish I really never wanted to stop eating! It was tender and the sauce was a flavor bomb. We had zero complaints at this restaurant. I would fly back to Vegas just to eat here again!
